snippet: Since Paul Mason had gastric bypass surgery in 2010 after weighing about 980 pounds, he has lost nearly two-thirds of his body weight, but the road to a new life is uphill.
abstract: Ipswich Journal; Ipswich, England, resident Paul Mason, once dubbed world's fattest man at 980 pounds, has lost nearly two-thirds of his body weight after 2010 gastric bypass operation; series of family and personal tragedies drove Mason to chronic overeating, but therapy and surgery helped turn his life around.
lead_paragraph: Since Paul Mason had gastric bypass surgery in 2010 after weighing about 980 pounds, he has lost nearly two-thirds of his body weight, but the road to a new life is uphill.

headline.seo: Paul Mason Is One-Third the Man He Used to Be
headline.main: One-Third the Man He Used to Be, and Proud of It
headline.print_headline: Two-Thirds the Man He Used to Be, and Proud of It
